reporting_cycle: Secretary-General reports not specified, but Committee to report within 30 days, and Panel of Experts to report within 90 days and 30 days prior to termination of its mandate
summary:
The Security Council, recalling previous resolutions, reaffirms that proliferation of nuclear, chemical, and biological weapons threatens international peace and security. It condemns the Democratic People's Republic of Korea's (DPRK) nuclear test on 25 May 2009, violating resolution 1718 (2006), and demands the DPRK not conduct further nuclear tests or launches using ballistic missile technology. The Council demands the DPRK:

- Suspend all ballistic missile activities and re-establish its pre-existing commitments to a moratorium on missile launches;
- Comply fully with its obligations under relevant Security Council resolutions;
- Retract its announcement of withdrawal from the Treaty on Non-Proliferation of Nuclear Weapons (NPT);
- Return to the NPT and International Atomic Energy Agency (IAEA) safeguards;
- Abandon all nuclear weapons and existing nuclear programs in a complete, verifiable, and irreversible manner.

The Council calls on all Member States to implement their obligations under resolution 1718 (2006) and decides that measures shall apply to all arms and related materiel, as well as financial transactions, technical training, advice, services, or assistance related to their provision, manufacture, maintenance, or use. States shall notify the Committee at least five days prior to selling, supplying, or transferring small arms or light weapons to the DPRK.
